column4: ok, i've got a question. Friend has installed nVidia driver but it'd giving him an error when starting gnome
i had the same thing a while ago with generic kernel conflict or something but cant remember how i fixed it
same here ...
got the same problem? or also had to fix it? anyone know how to overcome it?
dmesg says: "nvidia: module license 'NVIDIA' taints kernel."
i did the following (bit annoying, but it works)
created a small script called "gdm.sh", containing:
#!/bin/sh
sudo rmmod nvidia &&
sudo modprobe nvidia &&
sudo killall gdm &&
sudo gdm
you have to remove the nvidia-module via rmmod, reinsert it and restart gdm...
its not a nice solution, but it works
is it a permanent solution?
dont hope so...
i'm also looking for a better solution
Is that a yes or no?
I remember installing a different kernel or something
for now its a yes
i honestly dont remember
ok is it going to screw anything else up? is it reversible? I only ask because this friend with the problem is a first time linux user
nope, everything else is fine
